intro: Pseudogalium paradoxum subsp. franchetianum, commonly known as the Franchet's bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, velvety texture.
